// Extracts a reference to the container from *insert_iterator.
457
template <typename OutputIt>
458
inline auto get_container(OutputIt it) -> typename OutputIt::container_type& {
459

461
    using OutputIt::container;
462

// Checks whether T is a container with contiguous storage.
468
template <typename T> struct is_contiguous : std::false_type {};
469
470
/**
471
  An implementation of ``std::basic_string_view`` for pre-C++17. It provides a
472
  subset of the API. ``fmt::basic_string_view`` is used for format strings even
473
  if ``std::string_view`` is available to prevent issues when a library is
474
  compiled with a different ``-std`` option than the client code (which is not
475
  recommended).
476

enum class type {
622
  none_type,
623
  // Integer types should go first,
624
  int_type,
625
  uint_type,
626
  long_long_type,
627
  ulong_long_type,
628
  int128_type,
629
  uint128_type,
630
  bool_type,
631
  char_type,
632
  last_integer_type = char_type,
633
  // followed by floating-point types.
634
  float_type,
635
  double_type,
636
  long_double_type,
637
  last_numeric_type = long_double_type,
638
  cstring_type,
639
  string_type,
640
  pointer_type,
641
  custom_type
642
};

  template <typename Char>                \

669
0
  return t > type::none_type && t <= type::last_integer_type;
670
0
}

0

673
0

0

// A buffer that writes to an output iterator when flushed.
955
template <typename OutputIt, typename T, typename Traits = buffer_traits>
956
class iterator_buffer : public Traits, public buffer<T> {
957
 private:
958
  OutputIt out_;
959
  enum { buffer_size = 256 };
960
  T data_[buffer_size];
961
962
  static FMT_CONSTEXPR void grow(buffer<T>& buf, size_t) {
963
    if (buf.size() == buffer_size) static_cast<iterator_buffer&>(buf).flush();
964
  }
965
966

967
    auto size = this->size();
968
    this->clear();
969
    const T* begin = data_;
970
    const T* end = begin + this->limit(size);
971
    while (begin != end) *out_++ = *begin++;
972
  }
973
974

  explicit iterator_buffer(OutputIt out, size_t n = buffer_size)

      : Traits(n), buffer<T>(grow, data_, 0, buffer_size), out_(out) {}
977

978

        buffer<T>(grow, data_, 0, buffer_size),
980
        out_(other.out_) {}

    FMT_TRY { flush(); }

    FMT_CATCH(...) {}
985
  }

    flush();
989
    return out_;
990
  }
991
  auto count() const -> size_t { return Traits::count() + this->size(); }
992
};

  template <typename T> FMT_CONSTEXPR20 FMT_ALWAYS_INLINE value(T& val) {
1353
    using value_type = remove_const_t<T>;
1354
    // T may overload operator& e.g. std::vector<bool>::reference in libc++.
1355
#if defined(__cpp_if_constexpr)
1356
    if constexpr (std::is_same<decltype(&val), T*>::value)
1357
      custom.value = const_cast<value_type*>(&val);
1358
#endif
1359
    if (!is_constant_evaluated())
1360
      custom.value = const_cast<char*>(&reinterpret_cast<const char&>(val));
1361
    // Get the formatter type through the context to allow different contexts
1362
    // have different extension points, e.g. `formatter<T>` for `format` and
1363
    // `printf_formatter<T>` for `printf`.
1364
    custom.format = format_custom_arg<
1365
        value_type, typename Context::template formatter_type<value_type>>;
1366
  }
1367
  value(unformattable);
1368
  value(unformattable_char);
1369
  value(unformattable_pointer);
1370
1371
 private:
1372
  // Formats an argument of a custom type, such as a user-defined class.
1373
  template <typename T, typename Formatter>
1374
  static void format_custom_arg(void* arg,
1375
                                typename Context::parse_context_type& parse_ctx,
1376
                                Context& ctx) {
1377
    auto f = Formatter();
1378
    parse_ctx.advance_to(f.parse(parse_ctx));
1379
    using qualified_type =
1380
        conditional_t<has_const_formatter<T, Context>(), const T, T>;
1381
    // format must be const for compatibility with std::format and compilation.
1382
    const auto& cf = f;
1383
    ctx.advance_to(cf.format(*static_cast<qualified_type*>(arg), ctx));
1384
  }
1385
};

// An array of references to arguments. It can be implicitly converted to
1653
// `fmt::basic_format_args` for passing into type-erased formatting functions
1654
// such as `fmt::vformat`.
1655
template <typename Context, size_t NUM_ARGS, size_t NUM_NAMED_ARGS,
1656
          unsigned long long DESC>
1657
struct format_arg_store {
1658
  // args_[0].named_args points to named_args to avoid bloating format_args.
1659
  // +1 to workaround a bug in gcc 7.5 that causes duplicated-branches warning.
1660
  static constexpr size_t ARGS_ARR_SIZE = 1 + (NUM_ARGS != 0 ? NUM_ARGS : +1);
1661
1662
  arg_t<Context, NUM_ARGS> args[ARGS_ARR_SIZE];
1663
  named_arg_info<typename Context::char_type> named_args[NUM_NAMED_ARGS];
1664
1665
  template <typename... T>
1666
  FMT_MAP_API format_arg_store(T&... values)
1667
      : args{{named_args, NUM_NAMED_ARGS},
1668
             make_arg<NUM_ARGS <= max_packed_args, Context>(values)...} {
1669
    using dummy = int[];
1670

  format_arg_store(format_arg_store&& rhs) {

  }

  format_arg_store(const format_arg_store& rhs) = delete;

  format_arg_store& operator=(const format_arg_store& rhs) = delete;

// A specialization of format_arg_store without named arguments.

/**
2028
  \rst
2029
  Returns a named argument to be used in a formatting function.
2030
  It should only be used in a call to a formatting function or
2031
  `dynamic_format_arg_store::push_back`.
2032
2033
  **Example**::
2034
2035
    fmt::print("Elapsed time: {s:.2f} seconds", fmt::arg("s", 1.23));
2036
  \endrst
2037
 */
2038
template <typename Char, typename T>
2039
inline auto arg(const Char* name, const T& arg) -> detail::named_arg<Char, T> {
2040
  static_assert(!detail::is_named_arg<T>(), "nested named arguments");
2041
  return {name, arg};
2042
}

// We cannot use enum classes as bit fields because of a gcc bug, so we put them
2051
// in namespaces instead (https://gcc.gnu.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=61414).
2052
// Additionally, if an underlying type is specified, older gcc incorrectly warns
2053
// that the type is too small. Both bugs are fixed in gcc 9.3.
2054
#if FMT_GCC_VERSION && FMT_GCC_VERSION < 903
2055
#  define FMT_ENUM_UNDERLYING_TYPE(type)
2056
#else
2057
#  define FMT_ENUM_UNDERLYING_TYPE(type) : type
2058
#endif

          FMT_ENABLE_IF(is_compile_string<S>::value)>

2959
  \endrst
2960
 */
2961
template <typename OutputIt, typename... T,
2962
          FMT_ENABLE_IF(detail::is_output_iterator<OutputIt, char>::value)>
2963
FMT_INLINE auto format_to_n(OutputIt out, size_t n, format_string<T...> fmt,
2964
                            T&&... args) -> format_to_n_result<OutputIt> {
2965
  return vformat_to_n(out, n, fmt, fmt::make_format_args(args...));
2966
}
2967
2968
template <typename OutputIt, typename Sentinel = OutputIt>
2969
struct format_to_result {
2970
  /** Iterator pointing to just after the last successful write in the range. */
2971
  OutputIt out;
2972
  /** Specifies if the output was truncated. */
2973
  bool truncated;
2974
2975
  FMT_CONSTEXPR operator OutputIt&() & noexcept { return out; }
2976
  FMT_CONSTEXPR operator const OutputIt&() const& noexcept { return out; }
2977
  FMT_CONSTEXPR operator OutputIt&&() && noexcept {
2978
    return static_cast<OutputIt&&>(out);
2979
  }
2980
};
2981
2982
template <size_t N>
2983
auto vformat_to(char (&out)[N], string_view fmt, format_args args)
2984
    -> format_to_result<char*> {
2985
  auto result = vformat_to_n(out, N, fmt, args);
2986
  return {result.out, result.size > N};
2987
}
2988
2989
template <size_t N, typename... T>
2990
FMT_INLINE auto format_to(char (&out)[N], format_string<T...> fmt, T&&... args)
2991
    -> format_to_result<char*> {
2992
  auto result = fmt::format_to_n(out, N, fmt, static_cast<T&&>(args)...);
2993
  return {result.out, result.size > N};
2994
}
2995
2996
/** Returns the number of chars in the output of ``format(fmt, args...)``. */
2997
template <typename... T>
2998
FMT_NODISCARD FMT_INLINE auto formatted_size(format_string<T...> fmt,
2999
                                             T&&... args) -> size_t {
3000
  auto buf = detail::counting_buffer<>();
3001
  detail::vformat_to<char>(buf, fmt, fmt::make_format_args(args...), {});
3002
  return buf.count();
3003
}
3004
3005
FMT_API void vprint(string_view fmt, format_args args);
3006
FMT_API void vprint(FILE* f, string_view fmt, format_args args);
3007
FMT_API void vprint_locked(FILE* f, string_view fmt, format_args args);
3008
FMT_API void vprintln(FILE* f, string_view fmt, format_args args);
3009
3010
/**
3011
  \rst
3012
  Formats ``args`` according to specifications in ``fmt`` and writes the output
3013
  to ``stdout``.
3014
3015
  **Example**::
3016
3017
    fmt::print("Elapsed time: {0:.2f} seconds", 1.23);
3018
  \endrst
3019
 */
3020
template <typename... T>
3021
FMT_INLINE void print(format_string<T...> fmt, T&&... args) {
3022
  const auto& vargs = fmt::make_format_args(args...);
3023
  if (!detail::is_utf8()) return detail::vprint_mojibake(stdout, fmt, vargs);
3024
  return detail::is_locking<T...>() ? vprint(fmt, vargs)
3025
                                    : vprint_locked(stdout, fmt, vargs);
3026
}
3027
3028
/**
3029
  \rst
3030
  Formats ``args`` according to specifications in ``fmt`` and writes the
3031
  output to the file ``f``.
3032
3033
  **Example**::
3034
3035
    fmt::print(stderr, "Don't {}!", "panic");
3036
  \endrst
3037
 */
3038
template <typename... T>
3039
FMT_INLINE void print(FILE* f, format_string<T...> fmt, T&&... args) {
3040
  const auto& vargs = fmt::make_format_args(args...);
3041
  if (!detail::is_utf8()) return detail::vprint_mojibake(f, fmt, vargs);
3042
  return detail::is_locking<T...>() ? vprint(f, fmt, vargs)
3043
                                    : vprint_locked(f, fmt, vargs);
3044
}
3045
3046
/**
3047
  Formats ``args`` according to specifications in ``fmt`` and writes the
3048
  output to the file ``f`` followed by a newline.
3049
 */
3050
template <typename... T>
3051
FMT_INLINE void println(FILE* f, format_string<T...> fmt, T&&... args) {
3052
  const auto& vargs = fmt::make_format_args(args...);
3053
  return detail::is_utf8() ? vprintln(f, fmt, vargs)
3054
                           : detail::vprint_mojibake(f, fmt, vargs, true);
3055
}
3056
3057
/**
3058
  Formats ``args`` according to specifications in ``fmt`` and writes the output
3059
  to ``stdout`` followed by a newline.
3060
 */
3061
template <typename... T>
3062
FMT_INLINE void println(format_string<T...> fmt, T&&... args) {
3063
  return fmt::println(stdout, fmt, static_cast<T&&>(args)...);
3064
}
